page.title: 15Eccleston Hospital St.Helens
page.content: Eccleston Hall Hospital Which is built in the grounds of Eccleston New Hall was opened in 1913.Originally used as a sanatarium for tuberculosis sufferers today it caters for the elderly.There are three wards-Haydock and Faxton for long stay patients and MacArthur Ward for short stay patients who are looked after by their GP's. There are no resident doctors but two consultants and two general doctors visit regulatly. Eighty nurses look after the patients.Porters,cooks,cleaning staff, physiotherapists,chiropodists and a hairdresser also work there. The patients' day is made as normal as possible.Meal times are very important and leisurely.In the afternoons the patients can do cooking as well as play Bingo and visit the local park.The t.v. is also popular.
